revised_title: Obituary of Oldfield Thomas: A Pioneering Mammalogist
tldr: Oldfield Thomas was a renowned mammalogist who made significant contributions to the field of zoology and taxonomy. He was responsible for the Catalogue of Marsupials, which remains a standard reference work, and played a crucial role in building the mammal collection at the Natural History Museum. His work expanded the understanding of mammalian species and sub-species through geographical distribution and adaptation to environment.
